column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Warm conditions over the long weekend and above average grassland conditions saw Scone agents pen just 631 cattle a 50% reduction on last week. Most of the regular buyers in place all working with reduced rates.
 
A sprinkling of lighter steer weaners selling to cheaper rates 284c to 396c/kg, over 330kg 28c/kg cheaper trading from 308c to 388c/kg to the re-stockers. One brighter note was light heifer veal to the trade which were 12c/kg dearer selling from 296c to 322c/kg with re-stocking types losing considerable ground making from 286c to 318c/kg.
 
Medium and heavy yearling steers to both re-stock and feed sold in the buyers favour 300c to 362c/kg. The majority of yearling heifers were back 20c/kg trading from 280c to 324c/kg.
 
The majority of the cows penned were in exceptional order and well over 520kg. The handful of lighter two score types sold from 180c to 246c/kg with a re-stocker order active, whilst the heavy prime cows slipped 23c to 33c/kg selling from 255c to 283c/kg.
 
Market Operator: Angus Barlow
